editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: ROBERT HOLCOT, ALAN OF LILLE, RICHARD FITZRALPH &c.; S. XIV ex. (part 1377)

msItem.author: ROBERT HOLCOT OP
msItem.title: Opus Quaestionum super Sententias
msItem.incipit: Vtrum quilibet uiator existens in gratia assentiendo articulis fidei mereatur uitam eternam
msItem.explicit: superius dictum est dicendum ad questionem et sic est finis 3. libri.
msItem.note: A list of the quaestiones follows on fol. 106rv.
pr. Lyon 1497, 1518 / repr. Frankfurt 1967; Stegmüller, Sent. 737; Kaeppeli 3499; Sharpe, Handlist, pp. 555–6.

msItem.title: Quaestio
msItem.rubric: Vtrum prescitus sicut et predestinatus faciens fructus bonos eterne uite meritorios possit decedere finaliter cum eisdem.
msItem.incipit: Istud dubium duo tangit, primum an facere fructus bonos eterne uite
msItem.explicit: non repugnarent hominis libertati uirtualiter inquisiuit &c.
msItem.note: Attrib. to Holcot by Bale (Appendix C, no. 44), citing this copy, probably only because it follows art. 1.

msItem.author: ALAIN DE LILLE
msItem.title: De Planctu Naturae
msItem.incipit: In lacrimis risus in luctus gaudia uerto
msItem.explicit: in sompno prior mistice apparicionis dereliquit aspectus.
msItem.finalRubric: [In another hand] Explicit enchiridion Alani minimi capelle de conquestione nature.
msItem.note: ed. N. Häring, Studi Medievali, 3rd ser., 19 (1978), 797–879.

msItem.title: Accentuarius
msItem.incipit: Quia inter sillabarum accentus maxime uidetur pro sacre scripture congrua seu debita expressione
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit accentarius scriptus anno Domini m.ccc.lxxvii. Cade.

msItem.note: Followed on fols. 141v-2 by short notes on grammar:
msItem.incipit: Quot significaciones habent usquequo patet per uersum

msItem.author: RICHARD FITZRALPH
msItem.title: De Pauperie Saluatoris
msItem.incipit: Sanctissimo in Christo patri ac domino karissimo meo Innocencio sexto
Benedictus Clemens VI sui regiminis anno viii
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Ricardi archiepiscopi Armachani Hibernie primatis de pauperie Saluatoris.
msItem.incipit: Iohannes. Quia circa rerum propter hominem creatarum inferius
msItem.explicit: totum retinens quod delectat qui semper es benedictus in s. s. amen.
msItem.note: I-IV ed. R. L. Poole, appendix to Wyclif, De Dominio Diuino (Wyclif Soc., 1890), pp. 263–4; V-VII ed. R. O. Brock, PhD diss. (University of Colorado, 1954); VIII unpr.; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 479, listing six copies, not this one. Followed by an index, arranged in six ‘sermones’, the last titled ‘sermonis annunciationis’, fols. 217v-18v.

msItem.title: ANON., Quaestio de Dilectione Dei
msItem.incipit: Vtrum solus Deus sit a quacumque rationali creatura super omnia supreme diligendus
msItem.explicit: quod non sequitur ratione forme uel materie.
msItem.note: A brief note, c. 1500, trimmed by the binder, at the head of fol. 238.

supportDesc.extent:
240 leaves (ii + 238) 300 220
230–50 150–70
The edges retrimmed with occasional loss of marginalia and stained red.
supportDesc.collation: A bifolium, 1–712, 810, 912, 1010, 11–1212, a bifolium, 13–2012; catchwords; quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with crayon in 2 cols; written in c. 50–55 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Several proficient anglicana hands of varying degrees of formality. Cade writes art. 4 in a low-grade bookhand influenced by anglicana.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials flourished in red, on fol. 1 with a partial border in the colours; red or blue paraphs; underlining in red. Decoration ceases from fol. 227.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position. fols. i and 238 were formerly pastedowns. At the foot of fol. 238 is the mark of the large iron chain-staple.

history.provenance: On fol. i, upside down, ‘Iste liber legatur collegio de Merton Halle a magistro Iohanne Rysborw quondam socio eiusdem domus cuius anime propicietur Deus amen.’ The inscription is repeated on fol. iiv, in a hand of s. xvii. Risborough (BRUO 1577–8) was fellow in 1373, until 1397.

Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with ‘D. 5, 12’ (canc.) and a table of contents, s. xvii, and ‘O. 1. 7. Art:’ canc. in pencil and replaced with ‘N. 2. 11’. Another hand writes ‘(In Coxe’s Catal. MS. Merton CXIII)’.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
